page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT AT SANDHEAD
page.content: The main sources of employment in our block are FARMING, WEST FREUGH, DISTRICT COUNCIL, and SERVICES( shops, hotels, and taxis ). Farming has seen many changes, with mechanisation; co-operative cropping of silage, hay, and cereals; and the introduction of computerised milking parlours reducing manpower needs by as much as 30% to 50%. Some of the skilled workers from West Freugh live in and around Sandhead, these being what the locals call " incomers " i.e. not natives. Most of the locals employed by The Freugh and the District Council earn their living in semi-skilled or labouring jobs. The shops and hotels employ mostly females with extra staff being taken on during the summer months. There is not much unemployment, but a lot of residents are retired pensioners.
